author: Tony Tobin
method: Place a flat baking tray in the oven and preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Pour the double cream into a saucepan over a high heat. Bring to the boil, then remove from the heat immediately and leave to cool for one minute.  Place the egg whites into a bowl and whisk until stiff peaks form. Place the egg yolks and grated cheese in a separate bowl. Whisk together and season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Pour the warm cream over the egg yolks and cheese and mix together well. Spoon a little of the stiff egg whites into the yolk mixture and mix well. Add the rest of the egg white and gently fold together with a metal spoon, being careful to maintain volume. Spoon the soufflé mixture into the pepper half, place onto the hot baking tray and place into the oven to bake for 8 minutes, until the soufflé has risen and is golden. To serve, place the pepper into the centre of a small warm plate.
ingredients: 100ml/3½fl oz double cream,  2 free-range eggs, separated,  100g/3½oz cheddar, grated ,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  ½ green pepper, cut lengthways, seeds removed
